poem:
The Rise and Fall

Velvet dawn of Mayfair's air,  
where stitched dreams rise—  
In push-up bra's gentle care—  
then unravel in televised sighs.  

Fame's shadowy grasp,  
veils the truth, soft and vast.  
In pandemic dance,  
lies hold sway—a fate's advance.  

Seams of fortune, sewn with haste,  
in threads of time, unravel and waste.
